metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10092 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: In Apache HTTP Server 2.4.0-2.4.39, a limited cross-site scripting issue was reported affecting the mod_proxy error page. An attacker could cause the link on the error page to be malformed and instead point to a page of their choice. This would only be exploitable where a server was set up with proxying enabled but was misconfigured in such a way that the Proxy Error page was displayed.

notes.Note: sbeattie> all 2.4.x up to 2.4.41 first two upstream patches are hardening

criterions.comment: apache2 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.41-1ubuntu1').
